page.title: 02Blithfield Reservoir
page.content: The Blithfield Reservir was opened by the Queen Mother in 1953. It was built to supply South Stafordshire by using the River lythe as the principle source of water. The water to be directed over 3 miles to Lichfield pumping and filteration works. The reservoir has a top water area of approx. 800 acres and a storage capacity of four thousand million gallons. The length is 2.4 miles and average depth is 18ft 6". The catchment area is 27,000 acres and extends northwards from Abbots bromley for 17 miles. approx. 16 million gallons of water are used a day, 5 millions o this for river compensation. To prevent pollution of the water sewarage was diverted from the Blythe Valley to the river Team. 2,350 acres of land (some farm land) were purchased.
